definition: what harm is there in (doing sth)
to hinder/(in the negative or interrogative) (no) harm/(what) harm

sentences.english: What harm is there if thy clothes become tattered and stained?
sentences.chinese: 你的衣服污损了又何妨呢？

sentences.english: When in doubt, just take the next small step.
sentences.chinese: 怀疑的时候，何妨为未来踏出一小步。

sentences.english: Why not spend the end of lying drunk.
You’re already engaging in conversations, why not ask people for some feedback?
sentences.chinese: 你已经加入了对话，那么何妨再寻求一些反馈呢？

sentences.english: If you can break your unhealthy eating habits, I can surely break a sweat.
sentences.chinese: 你都可以改正不良饮食习惯，我流点汗又何妨？
德国和日本何妨把臂同去。

sentences.english: Among so many sad souls, what was one more?
sentences.chinese: 有这样多悲伤的灵魂，多一个又何妨呢。

sentences.english: Dongfeng everywhere to be believed, then why not this, the cage Hong seek drunk.
sentences.chinese: 须信处处东风，又何妨对此，笼香觅醉。

sentences.english: This product is one hundred yuan is not that, then why not try?
sentences.chinese: 本产品一百元都不到，试试又何妨？

sentences.english: Do not always say that their old, out of mind the old, white-haired then why not?
sentences.chinese: 不要总说自己老了，心不老，白发苍苍又何妨？

definition: old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
not as good as/not equal to/inferior
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
your kind offer/your valued advice/delicate interest and charm
to hinder/(in the negative or interrogative) (no) harm/(what) harm
why bother?/is it worth the trouble?
not to mention ... (i.e. in addition to sth)
